title: Odd-Ball Correspondence School Short Story
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130622083534im_/http:/typophile.com/files/International_LibraryofTechinology_3509.png)

While researching the International Correspondence School recently, I was reminded of the odd-ball J.D. Salinger short story about a young man reduced by sad financial circumstances to take a job as a correspondence art course instructor, "De Daumier-Smith’s Blue Period": [http://www.freeweb.hu/tchl/salinger/blueperiod.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20130622083534/http:/www.freeweb.hu/tchl/salinger/blueperiod.html "http://www.freeweb.hu/tchl/salinger/blueperiod.html")

I was researching the correspondence school to find out from where this technical text book came: [http://books.google.com/books?id=f6lIAAAAMAAJ&dq=International+Library+o...](http://web.archive.org/web/20130622083534/http:/books.google.com/books?id=f6lIAAAAMAAJ&dq=International+Library+of+Technology...Engraving+and+Printing+Methods&printsec=frontcover&source=bl&ots=PAJapulqki&sig=4a-yjKy_RMPTHb7Kjy_awj9MlMY&hl=en&ei=6VwdS9OfF9OWtgeSod3SAw&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=1&ved=0CAgQ6AEwAA#v=onepage&q=&f=false "http://books.google.com/books?id=f6lIAAAAMAAJ&dq=International+Library+of+Technology...Engraving+and+Printing+Methods&printsec=frontcover&source=bl&ots=PAJapulqki&sig=4a-yjKy\_RMPTHb7Kjy\_awj9MlMY&hl=en&ei=6VwdS9OfF9OWtgeSod3SAw&sa=X&oi=book\_result&ct=result&resnum=1&ved=0CAgQ6AEwAA#v=onepage&q=&f=false")

There’s a great article about correspondence art schools by Steve Heller in the 12.15.09 Design Observer: [http://observatory.designobserver.com/entry.html?entry=7687](http://web.archive.org/web/20130622083534/http:/observatory.designobserver.com/entry.html?entry=7687 "http://observatory.designobserver.com/entry.html?entry=7687")
author: nancy sharon collins
